alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 7:05AM EST until January 14 at 4:15AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Stony Creek, Sebrell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River near Stony Creek. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Jarratt boat ramp, approximately 5 miles upstream, has water completely covering the concrete boat launch area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Saturday was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.6 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 01/22/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM EST.
